1.title: Text a bot for book suggestions
1.subtitle: Twitter user @ecmoy created a bot that you can text for recommendations of books written by Black authors based on genre. It will also link you to a Black-owned bookstore that is selling the title. Text (409) 404-0403 to try it!

1.title: "ABC I Love Me"
1.subtitle: ABC I Love Me takes Black children along for a journey of self love, confidence, and adventure while teaching young learners positive affirmations for each letter of the alphabet. This book encourages children to accept their unique qualities, and promotes positive self-esteem and a healthy lifestyle.

2.title: Ka'oir Fitness
2.subtitle: Ka'oir Fitness, founded in 2011 by celebrity Keyshia Ka'oir is a fitness line of patented, trademarked fat burners to help people lose weight faster than ever.

products.name: Ka'oir Waist Eraser™
products.description: Ka'oir Waist Eraser™ will have your waist, stomach & back looking amazing. This is a unisex fitness product which burns belly & back fat, sheds excess water and shrinks waist size....all while allowing your abs to be more visible. It allows you to spot train your stomach, back  & waist.

products.name: Ka'oir Body Sweat™
products.description: The Ka'oir Body Sweat is a state of the art "sweat" suit. It is very stretchy, flexible & comfortable for any workout. KA'OIR Body Sweat will make you sweat tremendously, your metabolism will increase, you will burn calories, lose weight & shed water!

products.name: Ka'oir Slimming Tea
products.description: KA’OIR Slimming Tea is a loose leaf tea packed in individual nylon tea bags that contains a powerful blend of natural ingredients to help slim your body! Each package includes 14 bags (78.4 grams) of detox tea, and is meant to be used every day or every other day.

2.title: Justice for Jacob Blake
2.subtitle: Jacob Blake is a loving father of 6 that deserves proper medical attention and legal representation. The funds raised through this Gofundme will go toward Jacob’s medical bills, family expenses, legal representation, support for his children and therapy costs.

3.title: The Case for Reparations
3.subtitle: Two hundred fifty years of slavery. Ninety years of Jim Crow. Sixty years of separate but equal. Thirty-five years of racist housing policy. Until we reckon with our compounding moral debts, America will never be whole.

3.title: John Hope - Biography
3.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

4.title: Sha'Carri Richardson's drug test suspension is the end result of racist policies
4.subtitle: Sha’Carri Richardson should have been spending the next month preparing to win the Olympic gold medal in the 100-meter dash. She had a shot after blazing through the event’s qualifying race last month in under 11 seconds. Instead, Richardson may not get to run at all in Tokyo after failing a drug test taken during the Olympic trials in Oregon. But it wasn’t a performance-enhancer that was in her system: It was marijuana.

4.title: Abbey Creek Winery
4.subtitle: Abbey Creek is the first black owned winery and vineyard in Oregons recorded history. We play hip hop in the tasting room and have a unconventional approach to the wine experience. Come see what "The Crick Life" is all about at abbeycreekvineyard.com

products.name: 2018 Sparkling Blanc de Noir #JanelleMonáe
products.description: Sparkling. Full of life. This wine is here to celebrate uniqueness and individuality without sacraficing community. No one can be just like you, you can't be like anyone else but that doesn't mean we are alone. Raise a glass and give a toast to the greatness that is you.

products.name: 2019 Pinot Noir Rose #Ohufancyhuh
products.description: What makes you feel like a goddess? What makes you feel like the man? Get yourself a bottle of this uniquely shaped magnum, post a pic on Instagram with the hashtag #OhUFancyHuh, tag us (@abbeycreekwine), and show us your fancy!!

products.name: Sparkling Pinot Gris #Shining
products.description: If I scream out "I'm sorry Ms. Jackson" and you don't say "Ooooo, I am for real", we ain't friends. I don't need that type of negative energy.

5.title: Plum Good
5.subtitle: Plum Good locally produces, discriminately sources and proudly brings to market the highest quality culinary and restorative spices, herbs and tea blends available. Our mission is to help bring flavorful nutrition available to our customers.  We make All Natural rubs and blends, teas, jams and sauces.

products.name: Paprika Lime Blend
products.description: This SALT FREE blend of citrus, paprika, garlic, and lime gives color, zest, and mouth watering flavor to fish, chicken, and poultry.

products.name: Organic Chai Tea
products.description: Black Tea, Ginger, Cardamom, Cloves, Peppercorns Cinnamon

products.name: Sweet & Hot Chocolate Sauce
products.description: A culinary gourmet delight for cooks and foodies alike! Choice serrano and chocolate peppers, dark chocolate, balsamic vinegar, raw sugar, cardamom and water make a mouthwatering marinade, topping or accompaniment and make everything it comes into contact with delicious.

5.title: Justice for Tete Gulley
5.subtitle: Tete Gulley was a 31 year old queer Black transient. She was also known by some of her family as Otis. She was found hanging from a tree on the evening of May 27th 2019 in Rocky Butte Park. The cause of death was determined to be suicide at the scene but there is evidence of foul play.

6.title: Criminal Justice Facts
6.subtitle: The Sentencing Project compiles state-level criminal justice data from a variety of sources. Using this state-by-state data feature, you can navigate between interactive maps, tables, and rankings that allow you to access and use these data.

6.title: Me and White Supremacy
6.subtitle: Based on the viral Instagram challenge that captivated participants worldwide, Me and White Supremacy takes readers on a 28-day journey, complete with journal prompts, to do the necessary and vital work that can ultimately lead to improving race relations.

7.title: Charge the cops who shot Jacob Blake
7.subtitle: Jacob Blake, 29, was shot by Kenosha, Wisconsin police officers in the back 7 times on August 23, 2020. Officers were on the scene due to a fight, which Jacob Blake was trying to break up. The cops who shot him need to be charged.

7.title: Open a random campaign to donate to
7.subtitle: Take the effort of decision out of it — tap here and we'll select a random campaign for you to support!

8.title: Seeing White Podcast Series
8.subtitle: Just what is going on with white people? Police shootings of unarmed African Americans. Acts of domestic terrorism by white supremacists. The renewed embrace of raw, undisguised white-identity politics. Unending racial inequity in schools, housing, criminal justice, and hiring. Some of this feels new, but in truth it’s an old story.

8.title: How to be an Antiracist
8.subtitle: This conversation with professor Ibram X. Kendi was recorded during the 2019 Aspen Ideas Festival in Aspen, Colorado. In it, he explores what an antiracist society might look like, how we can play an active role in building it, and what being an antiracist in your own context might mean.

products.name: Acai Mango Lotion

products.name: Kinks Curls & Coils Haircare Bundle
products.description: Bundle and Save! Treat your coils to a start to finish process of our amazing haircare line.

9.title: The Legacy of Malcom X
9.subtitle: This podcast series about Malcom X El-Hajj Malik El-Shabazz brings together scholars from a variety of fields and is an invitation to connect our ideas, research projects, and activism across disciplinary divides.

10.title: Brown v. Board: Timeline of School Integration in the U.S.
10.subtitle: Trace school integration from 1849 to 2007.

10.title: MoreFire! Hot Sauce

Yummy Buddy has crinkly ears, both chewable "glow" silicone hands, teething bib, multiple colors, and chimes when shaken, too! The perfect sensory chew toy.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows
products.description: These cozy throw pillows feature high-quality fabric and prints that will upgrade your space. Zippered cover care instructions: machine wash in cold water using mild detergent and gentle cycle only, hang to dry.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T

Dating back to 1865, it was on June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free.

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T
products.description: "Black Powered" T-Shirt - When I think about the greatness of us and all that we've been able to become DESPITE all that we've been through and STILL going through, one reason that is specific to us is, US.

13.title: The Other Wes Moore
13.subtitle: Two kids named Wes Moore were born blocks apart within a year of each other. Both grew up fatherless in similar Baltimore neighborhoods and had difficult childhoods; both hung out on street corners with their crews; both ran into trouble with the police. How, then, did one grow up to be a Rhodes Scholar, decorated veteran, White House Fellow, and business leader, while the other ended up a convicted murderer serving a life sentence?

products.shopName: Black Beard Brigade Men's Grooming Co.

14.title: Hiram Rhodes Revels - Biography
14.subtitle: A freeman his entire life, Hiram Rhodes Revels was the first African American to serve in the U.S. Congress. With his moderate political orientation and oratorical skills honed from years as a preacher, Revels filled a vacant seat in the United States Senate in 1870.

15.title: Dawoud Bey: The Birmingham Project
15.subtitle: In 2005 American photographer Dawoud Bey visited Birmingham, Alabama, to explore the possibility of making work that would commemorate the September 15, 1963, bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church. The Birmingham Project, a series that includes photographic diptychs and a split-screen video, is Bey’s powerful response.

15.title: Legends profile: Michael Jordan
15.subtitle: By acclamation, Michael Jordan is the greatest basketball player of all time. Although, a summary of his basketball career and influence on the game inevitably fails to do it justice, as a phenomenal athlete with a unique combination of fundamental soundness, grace, speed, power, artistry, improvisational ability and an unquenchable competitive desire, Jordan single-handedly redefined the NBA superstar.

16.title: 210 Teas
16.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

16.title: Change.org: Justice for Daunte Wright
16.subtitle: 20 year old man Daunte Wright, a father to a two year old, was murdered by Minneapolis-area police. Help get him and his family justice by signing this petition.

19.title: Know Your Rights Camp
19.subtitle: Colin Kaepernick's organization's mission is to advance the liberation and well-being of Black and Brown communities through education, self-empowerment, mass-mobilization and the creation of new systems that elevate the next generation of change leaders.

20.title: Understanding My Privilege
20.subtitle: University Chancellor, Susan E. Borrego, reflects on her life as an emancipated minor and dissects the emotionally charged conversation surrounding race relations in the United States. This raconteur uses her powerful first-person account of "White Privilege" and "Black Lives Matter" to underscore the responsibility each one of us has to bring about change.

20.title: The Collective PAC
20.subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

21.subtitle: Kultured Misfits is a lifestyle, sport and ready-to-wear brand based out of Atlanta, Georgia. With a heavy influence from culture found in music, film, and art, we are driven to create timeless work by portraying an aesthetic that is uniquely our own to impact our everyday life.

products.name: Kultured Misfits Tracksuit (Crew + Joggers)

products.name: MISFIT Embossed Crewneck

21.title: Aisha Likes It
21.subtitle:
It began with a problem. I kept looking for the kind of refined, eclectic, Afrobohemian jewelry I really wanted to wear to no avail. Certainly, there was Africa-inspired jewelry available, but much of it lacked the bohemian design aesthetic that fit my taste and style as an African American literature professor. I wanted pieces that could say a lot without doing a lot. My jewelry needed to standout and be distinctive while remaining wearable. I wanted a jewelry wardrobe that reflected my tastes, my passions, my culture, my research interests. And so I began to make my own, sourcing authentic, African diasporic materials, curating and refining my work as my knowledge and skill developed. Eventually, I decided to share my work and Aisha Likes It came into existence.

Aisha Likes it is home to African-inspired jewelry curated towards a bohemian aesthetic created with both ethically sourced materials from throughout the African diaspora and traditional semi-precious stones. Each piece is designed to make a statement at a fair price.

22.title: Support the Equal Justice Initiative
22.subtitle: Your contribution is critical to efforts to end mass incarceration and excessive punishment in the United States, challenge racial and economic injustice, and protect the basic human rights for the most vulnerable people in American society.

22.title: Enough is Enough! Fire the Cops Who Killed Daunte Wright
22.subtitle: Here’s what we know: Police officers in Brooklyn Center, a Minneapolis suburb, shot and killed Daunte Wright during a traffic stop on Sunday, April 11. An unnamed police officer shot a gun into Daunte’s car, and his car then hit another vehicle. A passenger in Daunte’s care was injured, and Daunte was pronounced dead at the scene.

23.title: Ava DuVernay's "13th"
23.subtitle: In this thought-provoking documentary, scholars, activists and politicians analyze the criminalization of African Americans and the U.S. prison boom.

23.title: Alaffia
23.subtitle:
Alaffia is an online Fair Trading company that specializes in soaps and beauty products. We aim to alleviate poverty and advance gender equality through the Fair Trade of indegenious resources and community empowerment projects.

Together, we’re cultivating beauty, equality and empowerment in West Africa and around the globe. Our women’s cooperatives in West Africa handcraft indigenous raw ingredients then the Alaffia team in Olympia, Washington creates the finished products. Alaffia returns the proceeds from the sale of these products to our communities to fund community empowerment and gender equality projects.

24.title: Mutt's Sauce

25.title: Dr. Ernest Everett Just
25.subtitle: Dr. Ernest Just was a pioneering African American biologist, academic and science writer. Just's primary legacy is his recognition of the fundamental role of the cell surface in the development of organisms.

25.title: Good Thoughts Tea Co

26.title: Learn about Julius Jones
26.subtitle: Listen to the Jason Flom & Kim Kardashian West talk about Julius Jones’ story.

26.title: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund
26.subtitle: Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice in a society that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans. LDF also defends the gains and protections won over the past 75 years of civil rights struggle and works to improve the quality and diversity of judicial and executive appointments.

27.title: Reopen Sandra Bland's Case
27.subtitle: Sandra Bland was arrested for a traffic stop on July 10, 2015 by Brian Encinia.  She was found dead in her cell three days later. Encinia was never indicted, in spite of the fact, that he physically assaulted her her on camera. There is a new video that has come to light, which may have been hidden from the grand jury.

27.title: Innocence Project
27.subtitle: Donate to help free the innocent. The Innocence Project exonerates the wrongly convicted through DNA testing and reforms the criminal justice system to prevent future injustices.

products.description: Our Lavender handcrafted soap, just like our Lavender bathsalts, smells like calming Lavender.

29.title: Taste by Dannie K

29.title: Walking While Black

30.title: Inn8 Apparel
30.subtitle: Your mind. Your body. Your individuality. Your imperfections. These are the things you are born with. They are innate. Embrace them. They are yours. Celebrate them. They are yours. Love them. They are you.

products.name: "Beholder" Embroidered Unisex Hoodie
products.description: Embroidered hoodies are custom made to order and will take approximately 2-3 weeks to receive apparel.  Crafted for comfort, this lighter weight sweatshirt is perfect for relaxing. Once put on, it will be impossible to take off.

products.name: "Human" Unisex T-Shirt
products.description: This heavy cotton tee has the classic cotton look and feel. Casual elegance will make it an instant favorite in everyone's wardrobe.

products.name: "A Soul Lost in Time" Premium Matte Vertcial Posters
products.description: Every room deserves to be special. These supreme quality print posters in various sizes serve as statement pieces, creating a personalized environment.

30.title: Post 21
30.subtitle: Post 21 was created by a Mother-Daughter duo who wanted a comprehensive marketplace that focused on products from Black-owned businesses. They felt strongly that there’s no reason why these products are consistently being discovered when they should be household names. So, they said let’s create the place we want to shop.

products.name: Ball is Life Dog Tag
products.description: Super cool, fun, and durable Pet ID Tags. There's a tag for you and your pet's personality! Comes with custom engraving, to make sure that your little one is never lost and can always find it's way home.

products.name: B is for Black Boy
products.description: B is for Black Boy was written to celebrate the awe-inspiring nature of the Black male. It speaks life into our Black boys and empowers them to manifest their highest potential. It's intended to author and assert positive representation of Black boys to all audiences.

products.name: Headband
products.description: Handmade upcycled padded headband, with satin ribbon on underside next to hair.

31.title: Fewer Cards
31.subtitle: Fewer Cards is a touchless smart card that allows you to express yourself and share who you are with others by exchanging contact information, social media, and data seamlessly. The concept of Fewer Cards started from the fact that exchanging paper business cards is wasteful and cumbersome.

31.title: Eb + Flo Boutique
31.subtitle: Eb and Flo started out as just a vision and manifested in 2020. Our CEO, Ebony Hunter, is a strong believer in living out your dreams while not only looking good but feeling good too. Our mission is to provide styles that flow with you from moment to moment, whether you’re making a quick run to the grocery store or meeting the girls for brunch. With comfort and quality in mind, we make looking lavish easy. Look good, feel good.

products.name: Classic Boss Lady Track Suit
products.description: Chic track suit for the lady on the go. Throw it on for a quick trip to the grocery store, a nail appointment, or dress it up for a cute brunch look.

products.name: Tedy Soft Sherpa Jacket
products.description: The warmest and most comfortable jacket you'll ever own! The Teddy Sherpa Jacket feels like a warm hug or like you're wearing a blanket. Features a drawstring hem that allows you to snatch that waist hunny *snap*snap*

products.name: "Thou shall not try me" T-Shirt
products.description: Mood 24:7! Let the folks know the deal in this super soft tee.
